intro: Tribulus micrococcus, commonly known as the small caltrop, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 30 cm tall, characterized by its spiny, triangular fruits that contain four seeds. The plant produces small yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough, hairy texture. Tribulus micrococcus is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
